tips: Specify columns instead of `*` for better performance.

example: SELECT * FROM orders JOIN users ON orders.user_id = users.id;
purpose: Combine rows from two or more tables
tips: INNER JOIN is default; LEFT JOIN includes all from left table.

example: WITH regional_sales AS (...) SELECT * FROM regional_sales;
tips: Makes complex queries more readable; supports recursion.

example: SELECT rank() OVER (PARTITION BY dept ORDER BY salary DESC) FROM emps;
purpose: Perform calculations across a set of table rows
tips: Does not collapse rows like GROUP BY.

example: SELECT count(*) FROM users GROUP BY country;
purpose: Group rows that have the same values
tips: Used with aggregate functions (COUNT, MAX, MIN, SUM, AVG).
Always specify column names for safety.
